thread.title: Review: ‘The Seabird’s Cry’ Amid Lives Buffeted by Wind and Waves

author: Karin Altenberg
title: Review: ‘The Seabird’s Cry’ Amid Lives Buffeted by Wind and Waves
text:
What are seabirds to us? Poets have always recognized them as tricksters and shape-shifters that cross into the liminal world of the imagined, while modern scientific findings have brought us closer to understanding their habits and their habitats. Threading together science and poetry with a sense of wonder, Adam Nicolson’s “The Seabird’s Cry” reminds us that these birds are always there at the edge of our existence: at once familiar and utterly mysterious.
The author grew up among the “deep and rooted beauty” of the gardens,...
